main event: A civilian in Fairborn, Ohio sighted an unidentified object on February 20, 1966 at around 6:40 PM.
interesting points: The object appeared to be falling towards the earth, with its trail illuminated from the south.
There were three aircraft at a higher altitude also sighted by the observer, but there was no sound.
The observer said the object had a 'funny way of controlling itself' and appeared to be 'intelligently controlled'.
The observer compared the object to a picture in a book by George Adamski about flying saucers.
The observer estimated the object to be about one-third the apparent size of the moon.
sighted object: A bright light in the sky
